alert.note: Alert for Humboldt (Nevada) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Dust Advisory issued June 12 at 1:46PM PDT until June 12 at 2:45PM PDT by NWS Elko
info.description: The National Weather Service in Elko Nevada has issued a * Dust Advisory for... Northeastern Humboldt County in northwestern Nevada... * Until 245 PM PDT. * At 140 PM PDT, a dust channel was 19 miles south of Kings River Valley, moving northeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...Less than two miles visibility with strong wind in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Satellite. IMPACT...Hazardous travel. The most dense dust plume will cross US Highway 95 from 22 miles north of Winnemucca to McDermitt. It will also affect State Route 293 from Orovada west to Kings River Valley. Locations impacted include... Kings River Valley, McDermitt, Orovada and Thacker Pass. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Blowing dust brings reduced visibility, leading to dangerous driving conditions. If driving, avoid blowing dust if possible. If caught in dense blowing dust, pull off the road, turn off your lights and keep your foot off the brake. Motorists should not drive into an area of blowing dust. PULL ASIDE STAY ALIVE!
